definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The third movement menuetto brings images ofcourtly balls and high tea.
sentences.chinese: 第三樂章的小步舞曲帶來宮廷舞會和高級茶會的景象。

sentences.english: He carried his girl-friend to the tea party yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天他陪着女朋友去參加茶會。

sentences.english: The tea party began at half past six.
sentences.chinese: 茶會下戰書六點半開端。

sentences.english: We had a tea party to celebrate our headmaster's silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲慶祝校長的銀婚舉行了一次茶會。

sentences.english: A barricade is Mother Gibou's tea.
sentences.chinese: 一座街壘，便是吉布媽媽的一場茶會。

sentences.english: Coffee and tea can leave stubborn marks on cups and mugs.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡和茶會在茶杯和馬克杯上留下頑漬。

sentences.english: Otherwise, he might as well move out of the White House, and hand the keys over to the Tea Party.
sentences.chinese: 不然，他還不如從白宮搬出去，將大權交給茶會黨。

sentences.english: He raked many classmates in to the tea party.
sentences.chinese: 他把許多同學拖來參加茶會。

sentences.english: She refused his invitation to the tea party.
sentences.chinese: 他請她參加茶會，她拒絕了他的邀請。

sentences.english: She tried to call you about the tea party.
sentences.chinese: 她爲開茶會的事曾給你打過電話。

definition: to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
appreciation of the finer things in life
